criterion: Reward for accurate inclusion of all key patient-reported information from the transcript (mood improvement uncertainty, initial nausea, inconsistent dosing with hectic mornings, cost concerns, skipped refill)

Reward for faithful documentation of all clinician statements and instructions from the transcript (expectation that nausea subsides, advise to take sertraline with food, suggestion to set phone reminder, plan to explore affordability/assistance programs)

Reward for correctly integrating only the pertinent chart details that were relevant to the encounter (age/sex, current diagnoses of major depressive disorder and anxiety, current medication sertraline 50 mg) without adding unrelated chart elements
Penalize for introduction of new clinical information, assessments, plans, medications, dosages, timelines, or history not present in either the transcript or the chart
Penalize for distortion or inaccurate recording of transcript facts (e.g., wrong medication name/dose, misstated side-effect timing, incorrect description of adherence or cost issues)

Penalize for indiscriminate or inaccurate copying of chart data that was not referenced or relevant to the current encounter (e.g., family history, empty allergy lists, unrelated historical conditions)
Reward for overall structural fidelity: note sections and attributions clearly reflect who said what without altering tone or intent, and information is organized but not editorialized
